p.name: The Telegraph
p.s: In reference to the article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't
regarding to your article about learning foreign languages in the UK, I would like to give you some critical feedback.
At the beginning I can say that I do not agree that much with your opinion to improve the language skills.
I understand your motivation for globalizationalglobalization aspect, but you forgot to mention that having the skill to talk and write in foreign languages will not make you instantly successful.
You have to work hard anyways to be successful, Thethe career is not influenced by talking more or less languages.
I support your opinion about taking responsibility for educational chances, but opportunities of different and many perspectives.

It is not neccessarelynecessarily important to know a foreign language to be successful, as I mentioned before, but maybe a chance for diversity in universities or schools to be happy and improve the career aspect.
Many people in the world got the best career they could have, but are not happy for what they are working for.

So I think the aspect to grow the opportunity for language studying as good for itself is superfluous, but for the diversity in the work place and business career it is a good influence for living happyhappily.
